emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems like Cursor AI evolve to autonomously write, debug, and optimize code, reducing human involvement in routine programming tasks.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: This technology could lead to significant job displacement in software development, prompting discussions on AI ethics, education, and reskilling programs.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will depend on the reliability of AI-generated code, integration into existing development tools, and regulatory approval for AI in critical systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Interplanetary Resource Management
emerging_technologies.description: Technologies for identifying, extracting, and managing resources on Mars and other celestial bodies, supported by autonomous robots.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: This could lead to new economic models, changes in geopolitical dynamics, and ethical considerations regarding the exploitation of extraterrestrial resources.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by the success of initial Mars missions, the economic feasibility of resource extraction, and international space law.

emerging_technologies.name: Brain-Cloud Interface
emerging_technologies.description: A system where individuals can store and access their memories or consciousness in the cloud via neural interfaces.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises profound ethical questions about identity, privacy, and the potential for mind control or surveillance.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on overcoming significant technical, ethical, and legal barriers, as well as public acceptance.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Transport
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous vehicles integrated into urban transport systems, reducing accidents and optimizing traffic flow.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in major cities, driven by government initiatives, public demand for safer transport, and technological maturity.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Cybersecurity
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that can autonomously detect, respond to, and mitigate cyber threats in real-time.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard across industries due to escalating cyber threats, with AI solutions becoming a necessity for digital security.

epoch_themes.description: A surge in AI applications across various sectors, moving from assistance to autonomy.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: This theme brings about changes in labor markets, personal privacy, and human interaction with technology.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global investment in AI, ethical AI guidelines, and regulatory frameworks for autonomous systems.

epoch_themes.description: Space exploration and colonization become tangible with the establishment of extraterrestrial bases.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Economic models shift, new geopolitical dynamics emerge, and humanity's sense of exploration is reignited.
epoch_themes.global_trends: International cooperation in space law, increased private investment in space ventures, and public fascination with space exploration.

epoch_themes.description: Advances in neural interfaces lead to cognitive augmentation and potentially mind uploading.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Raises fundamental questions about consciousness, identity, and the nature of human experience.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Ethical debates, regulatory frameworks for neural technologies, and shifts in education towards cognitive enhancement.
